text:
Fixes the breakages to Nilearn gallery
- makes 5 items per row (changeable if necessary)
- Hovering docstring tooltips added 
- Some js cleanup

Very close to finished - so MRG soon.
Tooltip needs a little bit of rounding off regarding positioning etc but it works well now

[Online build](http://jaquesgrobler.github.io/online-sklearn-build/auto_examples/index.html)

text:
This is just beautiful work! The code is simple and I really like the visual result.

I'd like @AlexandreAbraham to have a look, and if you could address my minor comment it would be great. But beyond that, I am :+1: for merge, and super positive about the result.
I fixed a few things in the CSS and merged. This was the last block to push the new nilearn website. Ouf! As we say in French.
Online build should be updated to latest now
This is an **html-noplot** build, by the way. So the plots aren't there
I think that caption below images should be centered.
@AlexandreAbraham  good point - thanks... fixing

I found the behavior of the tooltip annoying in a particular situation: if you go on a figure, make the tooltip appear and then go right to hover the next figure (trhough the tooltip) I would like the tooltip to disappear. No other comment on the rendering: it's far more better than the previous one.
whoops - deleting this

If I am not mistaken, these lines are actually useful: if you change an example, it forces sphinx to re-run it. Ideally, there should be a test of files modification date (if the script is newer than the image, re-run it, otherwise keep the already computed image). Have you tested that these lines are superfluous ?
title: (5, 42, u'doc/Makefile')

text:
Even if it works, I really doubt that adding a `tooltip` field to a `div` is standard. I think that HTML 5 introduce a way to store custom data (throught the data-\* fileds) but otherwise, this may cause trouble. Hace you tried it on older browsers ?

At least, renaming it `data-tooltip` has to be done, so we are HTML 5 compliant. At best, I think that we could use an existing unused tag like `title`.
